description: Very simple to use, no background resources being hogged when not in use. I created a local folder called Google_Drive and did the one-time authentication step to link this folder to my actual "Google Drive" folder in the cloud. I only store documents I want saved in the cloud in this local folder. I consider the lack of a real-time-sync feature to be a benefit. It is very simple to issue a manual "Push" or "Pull" command from any device that you have authenticated and you can easily maintain current copies of your personal files across multiple devices with no fear of any automated deletions. Also makes it very easy to get up and running on a new linux machine, just load the tiny app, create/authenticate a local Google_Drive folder, issue a "Drive Pull" command from within that folder and voila, you're up and running. I love it! Thanks for developing/maintaining this indispensable tool!

This is a very simple and usable tool for sharing folders and files between Google Drive and your local system. The only thing that it lacks (or maybe I didn't understood and in that case I would love to know how) is a system to manage files that you do not want to "push" or "pull", in the spirit of ".gitignore". This would really help to save time and memor without copying and sharing useless things.
Thanks for this app anyway, it is a very precious tool!
